Keywords: Asgardian , Cosmic , Deity , Herald , Ruler
Real Name: Thor Odinson
Special Powers
TARGETING: Hindering, Adjacent
POWER TAKEN, NOT GIVEN: When Thor clears 2 action tokens, give him a Power Cosmic token.
HERALD OF THUNDER: Charge, Running Shot, Sidestep.
POWER COSMIC BLEEDING THROUGH ENCHANTED URU: Thor has an additional target for each Power Cosmic token he has. // When Thor hits 3 or more characters, instead of normal damage, each hit target is dealt damage equal to his printed damage value.
THE GOD BLAST: STOP. Toughness. // When Thor targets a single opposing character, before rolling you may remove up to 3 Power Cosmic tokens to modify his damage by the amount of tokens removed.

Comments
March 22, 2022
Gensan
Want to make sure that anyone reading this in the future understands that his ability to do printed damage does not work with Pulse Wave or Energy Explosion. Any mandatory "instead of normal damage" clause in a power or ability you activate as part of an action must be used instead of any others. Wizkids actually clarified this in their comprehensive rules update: "When activating an action that includes a non-optional "instead of normal damage" effect, players must apply that effect and ignore any other "instead of normal damage" effects"
November 19, 2021
Redrover454
@peeterparkker yup. Which seems to me to be about the only efficient way to play this guy, is equipped, or maybe with Nathaniel Richards. A 5 dmg PW or PenQuake with his reach is absolutely devastating and, in many cases, could essentially win you the game in one action. He's not super hard to take down, but if your opponent is sitting across from this guy with a pick-a-power, they will have to be VERY careful about how they place and mobilize their force. Going first or second with this guy doesn't really make a difference. First? Deploy him as far into the map as you can without allowing a hit out of the start zone and box your opponent in. Second? Hold him back, draw your opponent in, and then come out on turn 2 with the nasty.
October 27, 2021
peeterparkker
So I give him exospex, he chooses pulsewave, he uses sidestep and running shot and moves 8 squares, then hits everyone within 5 squares for 5 damage each? Yikes.
